Toggle Menu

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2

DigitalOcean Cloud Module v2

The DigitalOcean cloud module is used to control access to the DigitalOcean VPS system.

Use of this module only requires the personal_access_token parameter to be set. Set up the cloud configuration at /etc/salt/cloud.providers or /etc/salt/cloud.providers.d/digital_ocean.conf: 

my-digital-ocean-config:
  personal_access_token: xxx
  provider: digital_ocean
depends

requests

avail_images

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.avail_images(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the images that are on the provider

avail_locations

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.avail_locations(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a dict of all available VM locations on the cloud provider with relevant data

avail_sizes

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.avail_sizes(
								call=None
								)

Details

Return a list of the image sizes that are on the provider

create

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.create(
								vm_
								)

Details

Create a single VM from a data dict

create_dns_record

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.create_dns_record(
								hostname,
								ip_address
								)

Details

Creates a DNS record for the given hostname if the domain is managed with DO.

create_node

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.create_node(
								args
								)

Details

Create a node

delete_dns_record

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.delete_dns_record(
								hostname
								)

Details

Deletes a DNS for the given hostname if the domain is managed with DO.

destroy

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.destroy(
								name,
								call=None
								)

Details

Destroy a node. Will check termination protection and warn if enabled.

CLI Example:

salt-cloud --destroy mymachine

get_configured_provider

Syntax

salt.cloud.clouds.digital_ocean_v2.get_configured_provider( )

Details

Return the first configured instance.

								)
